intro: Acroptilon serratum, commonly known as the prairie smoke, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery plumes that resemble smoke, which appear at the top of the plant. The species belongs to the family Asteraceae, also known as the sunflower family, and is known for its showy, pinkish to purple flowers. It typically grows in prairies and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
